game

Interface IGame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameSingleThread, GameThreadSafe

    public interface IGame
    All versions of the game should do these things. Primarily so that the single thread and multithreaded versions can be swapped easily, but other implementations could be added with different game rules also.
    Author:
    matt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      State getCurrentState()
      Get the runner's state.
      boolean getFailureStatus()
      Get whether the game is considered to be in a failed state.
      void makeNewWorld()
      Reset the runner to its starting state.
      void step(boolean[] commands)
      Advance the game by one timestep with the given commands.
      void step(boolean q, boolean w, boolean o, boolean p)
      Advance the game by one timestep with the given commands.

    • Method Detail

      • makeNewWorld

        void makeNewWorld()
        Reset the runner to its starting state.

      • step

        void step(boolean q,
          boolean w,
          boolean o,
          boolean p)
        Advance the game by one timestep with the given commands.
        Parameters:
        q - Whether q is pressed on the keyboard (true is pressed down).
        w - Whether w is pressed on the keyboard (true is pressed down).
        o - Whether o is pressed on the keyboard (true is pressed down).
        p - Whether p is pressed on the keyboard (true is pressed down).

      • step

        void step(boolean[] commands)
        Advance the game by one timestep with the given commands.
        Parameters:
        commands - Array of keypress commands to use while advancing the physics by one timestep.

      • getCurrentState

        State getCurrentState()
        Get the runner's state.
        Returns:
        State of the runner at the current timestep.

      • getFailureStatus

        boolean getFailureStatus()
        Get whether the game is considered to be in a failed state.
        Returns:
        Whether the game is failed (true is failed).
